intro: Gonolobus ganglinosus, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces a milky latex sap, which is a common feature among members of its family. It typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in savannas, forests, and along roadsides. Gonolobus ganglinosus is also known for its ecological importance, providing nectar for various pollinators.
